alert.note: Alert for Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 16 at 5:27PM MDT until March 16 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southern Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Glasscock County in western Texas... Andrews County in western Texas... Ward County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Crane County in western Texas... North central Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Ector County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Northeastern Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Reagan County in western Texas... Winkler County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... Martin County in western Texas... Loving County in western Texas... Upton County in western Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT/630 PM MDT/. * At 626 PM CDT/526 PM MDT/, a wall of dust was located along a line extending from Forsan to near Midland International Air and Space Port to 12 miles east of Kermit to 19 miles northeast of Red Bluff Reservoir, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 52 and 228. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Big Spring, Andrews, Monahans, Kermit, Colorado City, Crane, Eunice, Jal, Wink, Rankin, Greenwood, Garden City, Mentone, Stanton, Coahoma, Loraine, Thorntonville and Grandfalls. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
